pr_title: Review Before Releasing Azure Cognitive Search

timeline.message: Added missing module-info export, added missing package-info, added missing linting annotations, and updated package-info Javadocs

timeline.bodyText: Why weren't these caught in checkstyle check before? Are we suppressing some valid checks?
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -792,8 +792,9 @@ SuggestPagedFlux suggest(String searchText, String suggesterName, SuggestOptions
      * @param suggesterName suggester name
      * @return auto complete result.
      */
+    @ServiceMethod(returns = ReturnType.COLLECTION)

replies.bodyText: I remembered checkstyle treated the SearchPagedFlux as Single return type.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: It should still have an annotation and should only be a suppression in checkstyle xml. I still don't understand why the annotation was completely missing.
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
I added the annotation for all APIs but got checkstyle error for the paging. Had a conversation with Alan, and decided to go without the annotation and add them back until checkstyle gets fixed.
FYI, the error message of the checkstyle is not exactly right as well.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * documents in an Azure Cognitive Search service index.
          
          
            
             * documents in an Azure Cognitive Search service.
timeline.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: What does checkstyle complain without the suppression?
timeline.author: sima-zhu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -490,4 +490,12 @@
   <suppress checks="MethodName|MemberName|ParameterName|VisibilityModifier" files="com.azure.spring.data.cosmos.domain|repository|config.*\.java"/>
   <suppress checks="ConstantName" files="com.azure.spring.data.cosmos.repository|common.*\.java" />
 
+  <!-- These suppressions were added due to limitations in our custom Checkstyle rules and should be addressed in the future. -->

replies.bodyText: I got the suppression here. Ignore the comment. :)
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
             * documents in an Azure Cognitive Search service index.
          
          
            
             * documents in an Azure Cognitive Search service.
timeline.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText:
Is this a confirmed change to add Cognitive in the Readme.
I remember @kaerm suggesting, Search isn't exactly a part of Cognitive umbrella..
timeline.author: samvaity
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@ The Azure Cognitive Search service is well suited for the following
 * In a search client application, implement query logic and user experiences
   similar to commercial web search engines.
 
-Use the Azure Search client library to:
+Use the Azure Cognitive Search client library to:

replies.bodyText:
We had a readme meeting which aligned to use Cognitive Search everywhere.
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/tree/master/sdk/search/Azure.Search.Documents
Will bring this up to the search v-team meeting if there is document to refer.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: The title of the service is Cognitive Search so that's what should be used here, it's just not one of Cognitive Services
replies.author: kaerm

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to mention it is a synchronous client?
timeline.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: Possibly, not completely certain. Some SDKs do call out synchronous vs asynchronous while others do not. I think we'll want to decide this at a higher level. For now let's move forward not calling it out.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Updates from comments, added to CHANGELOG
